content.webTitle: Uefa aims to cut foreign players

fields.headline: Uefa aims to cut imports
fields.bodyText: The Uefa president Lennart Johansson has warned Europe's top clubs that he is confident of reintroducing a limit on foreign players in European club competitions soon in order to arrest a "worrying trend among top clubs". "Today I can go and watch a game between an English club and a Greek club and not see a single English player in the English team and not a single Greek player in the Greek team, and that makes you worried," Johansson said yesterday. Asked about how many English players he would like to see in, for example, Arsenal's starting XI, he said: "It has got to be a majority of the players, so at least six of the players. "There are several of the big clubs in Europe who agree with us in this matter and the fact that clubs should spend more time on developing their young players. Even the big clubs have realised that they have to guard their own identity."
